question.text: Which of the following statement(s) (are) correct regarding the root mean square speed <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> and average translational kinetic energy <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> of a molecule in a gas at equilibrium?

options.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub></math>  is doubled when its temperature is increased four times

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></msub></math>  at a given temperature does not depend on its molecular mass

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow></msub></math>  is inversely proportional to the square root of its molecular mass

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">ε</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></msub></math>  is doubled when its temperature is increased four times

solution.text:
Urms=3RTM, Eav=32RT
If temperature is made 4 times, Urms between twice.
Avg. kinetic energy (Fav) is independent of molecular man at a given temperature,
Urms inversely proportional to the square not of molecular mass.
